blog.name: ao3feed-sansan
blog.title: Sansan Feed
blog.description: Sansor/Sansa AO3 feed. Askbox on just in case. Happy shipping!

title: The Wolf and the Hound
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2pkPDtO

by KiaraMGrey

This takes place after the BotB. When Sandor sees Sansa, all of the old feeling he felt in Kings Landing force their way to the surface, and he hates himself for them. But Sansa is not a fragile little bird anymore. She is a woman and a wolf, and she is done being afraid. She will take what she wants and will not apologize for it. But do either of them really know what they want?

Words: 6207, Chapters: 4/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Sandor Clegane, Sansa Stark, Arya Stark, Jon Snow
  • Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane & Sansa Stark
  • Additional Tags: Romance, Eventual Romance, Drama & Romance, Royalty, Angst, Sex, SanSan Week, Winterfell, Conflict, Secret Relationship, Older Man/Younger Woman


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2pkPDtO

blog.name: gameofthoned
blog.title: Game of Throne(d)
blog.description: GOT memes, rambles, info & appreciation (for the cast/characters not D&D or the themes & narratives within the story lol)

summary:
• Sansa Stark •
Sansa Stark is the eldest daughter of Eddard Stark and Catelyn Stark (neè Tully). She is the sister of Robb,...
body:
• Sansa Stark •

Sansa Stark is the eldest daughter of Eddard Stark and Catelyn Stark (neè Tully). She is the sister of Robb, Bran, Arya and “half-sister” of Jon Snow. She was born & raised in Winterfell.

As a young girl, Sansa emulated the feminine standards and was very naive - she only wished to marry a highborn man and be a wife and mother. After significant manipulation, Sansa learnt to lie and manipulate others to her own means as best as she could.

Due to what she has suffered, Sansa has significantly darkened in personality but has not become cruel. She has developed as a political force, as evidenced by how she is effective as Lady of Winterfell.

Sansa is also compassionate, intelligent and a strong leader. What she has endured as opened her eyes to reality and, thus, she come out on the other side with many more skills. On the other hand, she is adept at manipulation and winning favour of many forces including the Knights of the Vale and the bannermen and lords of the North.

Will Sansa Stark aim for the Iron Throne?

summary: In that AU that I never stop talking about--after the death of Ned--Sansa and Arya enter a very deep and very troubling...
caption:
In that AU that I never stop talking about–after the death of Ned–Sansa and Arya enter a very deep and very troubling depression. Meanwhile, on the other side of the city, Jeyne Poole isn’t having a grand ol’ time either.

Eventually, somehow, the girls escape. They take Sandor with them (he goes after them) for protection, and find Jeyne somewhere and take her too, because why not.

tags: would not be a nice tie up
summary: Do u buy into the sansa kidnapping plot?
question: Do u buy into the sansa kidnapping plot?
answer:
Dear nonny,
I must admit that I see the possibility for several reasons : some of the dialogue in season 7 could be seen as foreshadowing this, like Sansa saying that she won’t go to KL as long as Cersei is there, Sansa abducted would be a great opportunity to show AngryKitten Jon Snow, and Cersei’s arc would have a nice tie up of she meets Sansa again and realises that Sansa has learned and yet did not become like her. Also there is the prophecy of the ‘younger and more beautiful Queen’ which might be Sansa and for Cersei to see Sansa before she dies and realise that she should have been afraid of Sansa all the time would be a great turn for her arc.
There is just one reason why I don’t like it and that is Sansa. To have her reduced to a damsel in distress again would rob her of the agency she has won in the last two seasons, and I must admit I would hate that. It is not only that I would hate it, I also think it would not make sense. We spent time in seeing Sansa grow and play an important part in ruling the North and suddenly she would be a pawn again.
Now if the kidnapping happens they could show Sansa freeing herself or being freed by Arya or Brienne and that would be better, but I would still have mixed feelings about it admit and probably would still be 'meh’ about it, unless it’s done very well.
In addition I don’t think that Cersei has to see Sansa to realise that Sansa is the one responsible for 'taking everything she holds dear’. And since the prophecy is more about Cersei’s paranoia than about Sansa as the fulfilment it is not necessary for her to be there when Cersei dies I think.
So there is some evidence for it but Sansa is the subverted trope of the 'princess in the tower’ and for her to get caught and abducted to King’s Landing just does not sit right with a subversion.
To sum up, I don’t think the evidence is conclusive and I’d rather not have it, not in canon anyway. Give me enraged Jon and kidnapped Sansa in a nice fic with a happy ending anytime!

(Partial OC content hiatus) Avatar Symbolism is a blog dedicated to exploring, and examining the symbolism, and parallels in Avatar: The Last Airbender and Avatar: The Legend of Korra. 
In addition to looking at the symbolism within the franchise, this blog will also explore the themes portrayed within both shows, as well as other aspects that make this franchise truly great.

summary: 🔥game of thrones, spit that salt friend
question: 🔥game of thrones, spit that salt friend
answer:
Sansa doesn’t start being brave and playing the game in AFFC or even ASOS.

No, my friends. It starts much earlier than that. 

It actually stars in ACOK during the Siege of King’s Landing. 

The queen has left the ballroom. Everyone is panicking. And what does Sansa do?

She never knew why she got to her feet, but she did. “Don’t be afraid,” she told them loudly. “The queen has raised the drawbridge. This is the safest place in the city. There’s thick walls, the moat, the spikes…” 

SHE GETS THE LADIES TO SETTLE DOWN! There is no way AGOT Sansa would do that, I think. I think she’d be just as terrified as the other ladies. 

She might still be learning her way around, trying to adjust, learning how things are done, but Sansa’s no fool. She learns.

blog.description: Everything before the word 'but' is horse shit. - Jon Snow

tags: the house of black and white
body:
THE HOUSE OF BLACK & WHITE

LF: Do you like the taste (of ale)?

Sansa: I don’t see what all the fuss is about. Why do men love it so much?

LF: It gives some men courage.

Sansa: Does it give you courage?

LF: …………………..

reblog.comment:
THE HOUSE OF BLACK & WHITE

LF: Do you like the taste (of ale)?

Sansa: I don’t see what all the fuss is about. Why do men love it so much?

LF: It gives some men courage.

Sansa: Does it give you courage?

LF: …………………..

blog.title: turtle-paced

summary: Do you think something important near the end is going to hinge on two or more Starks having total blind faith in their family...
question: Do you think something important near the end is going to hinge on two or more Starks having total blind faith in their family bonds and making a giant leap trusting that a sibling is not going betray them? Because that might explain what the show writers were thinking with Sansa & Arya, like they were conscious of the thing where Sansa would never be afraid of Arya & Arya would never think Sansa was trying to elevate herself at the cost of Jon/Bran, but they didn't bother showing that on screen
answer:
I think Stark teamwork and love is going to be vital to the end of the series, yes. They’ve been kept apart so long so that it matters when they get back together, both emotionally and to how the external conflict plays out; Sansa, Arya, and Bran in particular have been getting training montages in three distinct and complementary skillsets. They can do more together than any of them can do apart.

I don’t think highly of how the show’s written Stark relationships in the past few seasons. The constant infighting and hostility, with so little justification, has displayed a real poverty of imagination.

tags: a song of ice and fire
juls (should not be allowed to) answer
question: Female jonsa 57
answer:
57. Sacrifice

The grey walls of Winterfell weren’t as they both remembered. Before everything happened before Sansa took the way for the South and they roads parted. They had never been so dark, so destroyed, despite the fact that they still stood, imperturbable in the snow-filled landscape. The walls were fine enough to sustain every kind of attack, as they always had been, though they foundations were shaking because it was just the two of them, the only two people to bring the Starks’ blood.

The Queen in the North turned to look at her cousin. Joanna’s dark long and curly hair was kept away from her face, tied in a braid, a secret smile, all only for Sansa herself, crept through her unreadable expression.

“Do you know you can’t change my mind, don’t you?” Sansa knew it. She tried so hard to find another way, everyone did. But Joanna didn’t want to give up her role, she wanted to protect her Queen, didn’t matter what. And she knew the only way was trying to stop the Night King long enough to let her escape.

“I wish I can,” Sansa whispered. “I wish I did a lot of things different.”

Whatever she wanted to have was silenced by the trumpet of one of the mammoths. “Go, before they arrive.”

Sansa nodded, she wanted to tell something to stop her cousin, but everything she could do was peak a kiss against her lips. Joanna followed her down into the courtyard where everyone was waiting, both for the Queen and for the commander of her army.

“Are you ready, Your Grace?” Brienne of Tarth asked her. Sansa nodded, a moment later Joanna was stepping through the gates of Winterfell. The Queen in the North knew she was giving her life up to save hers. She turned her own horse, going for the other gate, and she couldn’t do nothing to hide her tears. 

send me a number and two characters
